channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The UK is buying F-35 fighter jets capable of carrying nuclear weapons—but they’ll need Trump’s approval before dropping bombs
item.description: The United Kingdom will buy 12 U.S.-made F-35A fighter jets capable of carrying nuclear bombs.

item.title: FedEx warns of pain ahead with tariffs weighing on demand
item.description: “We just simply cannot predict how that is going to play out,” FedEx Chief Customer Officer Brie Carere said.

item.title: Trump’s budget bill and DOGE’s IRS staffing cuts could lead to a nightmare 2026 tax season, watchdog warns
item.description: The IRS lost one-quarter of its employees through staffing cuts, an independent watchdog reported Wednesday.

item.title: In a win for 14 states, Trump must release Biden-era EV charger funding

item.title: Anthropic Just Made Vibe Coding With Claude Absurdly Easy
item.description: A new update means that if you want to build AI-powered apps using Claude, you’re in luck.

item.title: Starbucks is changing how it charges for extra syrups, matcha powder
item.description: CEO Brian Niccol has been working to reverse a sales slump at Starbucks since he took the helm in September.

item.title: After 100 Years of Powerful Research, Color Speaks
item.description: Rediscover this silent force that shapes who and what we remember.

item.title: What Is a Cool Meeting—and Why You Should Start One
item.description: With no deliverables or agenda, it’s a place to share informally.

item.title: Want to Give Your Staff Their First Choice of Benefits? Try Paid Overtime, a Survey Says
item.description: To recruit top professional talent today, you may have to offer new perks—like a 4-day work week or extra money for long hours.
